alert.note: Alert for Grant; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 8:24PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN GRANT...NORTH CENTRAL OWEN COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 823 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Warsaw, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Glencoe, Sparta, Munk, Sherman, Northcutt, Elliston, Eagle Hill, Williamstown Lake, and Verona. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 158 and 166. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
